intro: Astragalus diphtherites subsp. karataschensis, commonly known as Karataschen astragalus, is a flowering plant species native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique morphological features, including its hairy leaves and specific floral structures. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. This plant is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native range.
